

TRY:
- nn inputs are state of rocket at last n timesteps
-- state of rocket and own output?

- fitness is only from the last 1 second of the run

- several phases of fitness: as long as too far from center ignore the facing, once near center reward coming to standstill.

- fitness is lexi. sorted array instead of number

- "max burn" vs "conserve fuel" objectives?

- fitness is only the highest encountered of all start conditions

- check that the rotation is able to fire at all





### PilotNet( [ 4, 4] ), f = sum of squared lengths of final positions and velocities, 10 s sim time, start pos 0,300 vel 0,0

------------------------
| Solution S_A_1 fitness 4.196366304028859e-7 

- "Oscillates" as it slowly approaches the origin which is reached after ca. 6 sec.
- In the origin the rocket wildly powers back and forth on the spot.

------------------------
| Solution S_A_2 fitness 2.5754644219082e-7

- Similar to S_A_1 but reaches origin in 3 sec. then wildly oscillates on the spot

------------------------
| Solution S_A_3 fitness 0.0000017453380463907863

- Takes almost 10 seconds to get to the origin, then same as before


### PilotNet( [ 4, 4, 4 ] ), f = sum of lengths of all positions, velocities, accel, 10 s sim time, 3 start pos

------------------------

this worked
		fitness[0] *= 0.99;
		const distRough = Math.trunc(dist / 25);
		fitness[0] += square(distRough) + (10 * avl + vel);


----------
7 7 7

"throwing axe" behavior
